intro: Malcolmia maritima, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers and silver-gray foliage. The plant thrives in coastal areas and sandy soils, making it well adapted to saline and well-drained environments. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for coastal gardens and xeriscaping.
